secret_rule: Only items that are used in a typical school classroom can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "pencil" and "notebook".
I will make a new guess. Can I bring a "calculator"?
Yes, you can bring a calculator.
I'll make a new guess. Can I bring a "textbook"?
Yes, you can bring a textbook.
I will make a new guess. Can I bring a "highlighter"?
Yes, you can bring a highlighter.
I will make a new guess. Can I bring a "binder"?
Yes, you can bring a binder.

Based on the provided examples and the game master's responses, my best guess for the rule is that you can bring any item that is typically used in a school or educational context, particularly for writing, organizing, or studying. Items like "pencil," "notebook," "calculator," "textbook," "highlighter," and "binder" all fit this criteria. Therefore, I guess the rule is: "You can bring items that are commonly used for educational purposes."
